page.title: 14Life of a Resident
page.content: We visited a man who lived in our square. He told us how the land that he owned had changed since he was a little boy. The land, he pointed out had once grown apple trees but now supported crops. The land behind the house used to grow cider apples. He has got a lot of land used for crops. But he does not farm the land himself he has a tenant farmer. We saw some people in his field lifting potatoes. Part of the house is very old the date of it is 1776. We went inside the house and up the stairs to the roof. We had a bird's eye view of all the land including his enormous garden.
